article_title: Electric-Car Perks Put Norway in a Pinch
article_text:
FINNØY, Norway—When Arne Nordbø drove his electric car under the toll gantry and into the mouth of a tunnel leading to this small Norwegian island on a recent Monday, he couldn’t repress a chuckle.

“They’ve just lost another $20,” said the Finnøy resident and occasional stand-up comedian.

On the losing side of Mr. Nordbø’s commute are...

twitter.description: Rich subsidies for emissions-free vehicles are straining the finances of a Norwegian tunnel that collects no fees from an island’s growing population of battery-powered cars.
twitter.title: Electric-Car Perks Put Norway in a Pinch

image.alt: Uncollected tolls on electric-cars ring alarms for a Norwegian island
